title: [BEAM-9547] Add implementations for some lesser-used pandas operations
body:
This PR adds support for a few lesser-used operations that are easy to implement. Some elementwise operations: - at_time - between_time - Series.explode (this was already implemented in DataFrame) - subtract, divide (aliases for sub, div) Some aggregation functions: - sem (standard error of the mean) - mad (mean absolute deviation) - skew - kurt/kurtosis Note all of these aggregation functions are implemented as unliftable aggregations here, but I think they can all be parallelized. skew and kurtosis can take a similar appraoch to std/var (filed BEAM-12550 for this). sem and mad will require more research to find a distributed algorithm (if one exists). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: Add MatchContinuously PTransform
body:
Adds `MatchContinuously` to Python SDK. This is has the same purpose as [`FileIO.MatchAll.Continuously`](https://beam.apache.org/releases/javadoc/2.30.0/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/FileIO.MatchAll.html#continuously-org.joda.time.Duration-org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.Watch.Growth.TerminationCondition-) but a different implementation, since `Watch` is not available. The idea is to use `PeriodicImpulse` and `MatchAll` to check for new files, and use a **StatefulDoFn** to remove duplicates. I added the `experimental` since in the future it may we worth changing to a Python version of `Watch` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12422] Vendored gRPC: Removing unnecessary log4j-api dependency
body:
Vendored gRPC 1.36.0 was using a log4j version with security issues. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-12422 gRPC does not declare log4j dependency. It uses java.util.logging for logging. Therefore this PR removes the dependency. # How I tested this I created https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15103 to confirm the vendored gRPC works fine by installing the vendored gRPC into local Maven repository. The checks passed: # Linkage Checker There's no reference to log4j-api in the result of Linkage Checker: https://gist.github.com/suztomo/4719cedebd20887b0a0dcd50f0f5a4f2 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9547] Identify remaining WontImplement operations
body:
I went through the remaining operations that have not been implemented yet and identified the ones that fall into one of our WontImplement categories. I _think_ after this only feasible operations remain. Here's a summary of the new `wont_implement_method`s in this PR: ### order-sensitive - asof (Series, DataFrame) - autocorr (Series) - first_valid_index (Series, DataFrame) - iat (Series, DataFrame) - is_monotonic (Series) - is_monotonic_decreasing (Series) - is_monotonic_increasing (Series) - last_valid_index (Series, DataFrame) - ohlc (GroupBy) - pct_change (Series, DataFrame, GroupBy) ### deprecated - lookup (DataFrame) - slice_shift (Series, DataFrame) - tshift (Series, DataFrame, Groupby) ### non-deferred-result - nbytes (Series) - to_clipboard (Series, DataFrame TODO) - to_list (Series) - to_xarray (Series, DataFrame) ### non-deferred-columns - swapaxes (Series, DataFrame) - infer_object (Series, DataFrame) - factorize (Series) ### event-time-semantics - ewm (Series, DataFrame, GroupBy) - expanding (Series, DataFrame, GroupBy) `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12533] Add simple `__repr__` for `DeferredDataFrame` and `DeferredSeries`
body:
Having a useful `__repr__` is important for an API that may be used in an interactive context, as jupyter notebooks will call `__repr__` on an object when it is the output of a cell. This PR is an alternative to #15072. It adds a simplified implementation for `__repr__` that just lists critical information about the DataFrame or Series (names of columns and indexes, and dtypes for Series). The repr for a pandas DataFrame might look like this: ``` index foofoofoo barbar bazzy zoop 0 0 one A 1 x 1 1 one B 2 y 2 2 one C 3 z 3 3 two A 4 q 4 4 two B 5 w .. ... ... ... ... ... 595 1 one B 2 y 596 2 one C 3 z 597 3 two A 4 q 598 4 two B 5 w 599 5 two C 6 t [600 rows x 5 columns] ``` With this implementation a similar Beam DataFrame will be displayed like this: ``` DeferredDataFrame(columns=['foofoofoo', 'barbar', 'bazzy', 'zoop'], index=) ``` A pandas Series: ``` 0 A 1 B 2 C 3 A 4 B .. 595 B 596 C 597 A 598 B 599 C Name: barbar, Length: 600, dtype: object ``` A Beam DeferredSeries: ``` DeferredSeries(name='barbar', dtype=object, index=) ``` See additional examples in the newly added `ReprTest`. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12541] Fix partitioning requirements for filllna with value=DataFrame or Series
body:
Previously we weren't requiring Index partitioning for `df.fillna(value=DataFrame)`, which prevented it from working correctly. Unfortunately we can't always just require index partitioning when `value` is a `DeferredFrame`, because when `value` is a `Series` it's supposed to specify the fill value for each column, not for each row. This PR works around that case using the same approach as `dot` to ensure the Series is materialized and broadcast to each partition. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-9547] Add support for xs on DataFrame and Series
body:
This PR adds support for [`xs`](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.xs.html) on DataFrame and Series instances. `xs` is really just a specialized filter on the index, which at first glance is trivially elementwise. However it is complicated by the fact that it raises a `KeyError` when the keyed value does not exist. In order to raise this error correctly (at execution time) in a distributed context, we need to know when we're processing the partition that _should_ contain the key. In order to do this we wrap the key in a DeferredSeries and use Index partitioning to co-locate it, thus if the key is present in a partition, we know to raise an error if it doesn't exist in the target frame. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12533] Define a `__repr__` for `DeferredDataFrame` and `DeferredSeries`
body:
Having a useful `__repr__` is important for an API that may be used in an interactive context, as jupyter notebooks will call `__repr__` on an object when it is the output of a cell. This PR adds an implementation for `__repr__` that seeks to emulate the pandas implementation, but omits the data in order to make it clear to the user that the dataframe is deferred and has not yet been materialized. The repr for a pandas DataFrame might look like this: ``` index foofoofoo barbar bazzy zoop 0 0 one A 1 x 1 1 one B 2 y 2 2 one C 3 z 3 3 two A 4 q 4 4 two B 5 w .. ... ... ... ... ... 595 1 one B 2 y 596 2 one C 3 z 597 3 two A 4 q 598 4 two B 5 w 599 5 two C 6 t [600 rows x 5 columns] ``` With this implementation a similar Beam DataFrame will be displayed like this: ``` index foofoofoo barbar bazzy zoop : : : : : : : : : : : : [?? rows x 5 columns] ``` A pandas Series: ``` 0 A 1 B 2 C 3 A 4 B .. 595 B 596 C 597 A 598 B 599 C Name: barbar, Length: 600, dtype: object ``` A Beam DeferredSeries: ``` : : : : Name: barbar, Length: ??, dtype: object ``` Note there's quite a bit of complexity in the implementation in order to deal with column and index names (and names for multiple levels of columns), as well as justification. Tests are added in frames_test.py::ReprTest to verify these cases. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12532] correctly handle LocalDateTime and LocalTime with 0 seco…
body:
…nds and 0 nanoseconds - toString strips out 0 seconds but seconds is required by BigQuery. Use ISO_LOCAL_TIME and ISO_LOCAL_DATETIME which always retains seconds. - Microseconds is optional in BigQuery. Don't include 0 nanoseconds to reduce bytes transmitted. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12456] Parallel querying in JdbcIO
body:
Design docs can be found here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wBzVhQEhTK23ALzTSZ_CVouEOXTm3w2-LjmO3ieUvFc/edit The proposed solution provides an extension for JdbcIO. This extension for JdbcIO supports parallel loading from JDBC sources with a query splitting mechanism. The user needs to specify a field for splitting the query, the range for values in this field, and the degree of parallelism. JdbcIO opens multiple connections to the database using split queries. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12504] Make SpannerIO.ConnectTransaction wait on input signal
body:
The current SpannerIO creates transaction at the beginning of pipeline run. This causes SpannerIO error by session not found if the pipeline runs long with `ReadAll` which gets `ReadOperation` as input . This change introduces a delayed transaction creation. It makes a pipeline able to create Spanner transaction when it is needed (e.g. just before ReadAll). Take a look at the code below with this change applied. It will creates a transaction session after `readOperations` is finished. FYI, the code will fail to compile with the current SpannerIO because `CreateTransaction` only accepts `PBegin` at the moement. ``` SpannerConfig config = ... PCollection readOperations = ... PCollectionView transaction = readOperations.apply(SpannerIO.createTransaction()); PCollection users = readOperations .apply(SpannerIO.readAll().withSpannerConfig(config).withTransaction(transaction)) ``` **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12474] Write PubsubIO parsing errors to dead-letter topic
body:
Current behavior of PubsubIO is to ignore parsing errors, relying on Pub/Sub dead-letter configuration to eventually send the message to a dead-letter topic. However, the message sent to the dead-letter topic loses all info on the error (though error logs should exist). Since parsing errors are also unlikely transient, it wastes a lot of resources with retries, and it can lead to infinite retry loops if no dead-letter is set up. This PR attempts to mitigate these issues by allow PubsubIO.Read to be configured with a dead-letter topic. To avoid some messiness with the `ExceptionAsMapHandler`, I added a handler to `WithFailures` that just returns the exception. This also requires a new wrapper around `Throwable` to override the default `equals` implementation. Otherwise, we'd get a ton of log spam about the coder mutating the exception. PubsubTestClient also needed to be updated to support testing this feature. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10708] Save and load coders correctly
body:
1. When writing to cache, always save the coder for later reading, instead of using the default safe fast primitive coder. 2. This allows xlang supported coders such as RowCoder to take effect so that SqlTransform applied to PCollection read from cache does not error out because of pickled python coder. 3. The WindowedValueHolder needs to be re-visited because it wraps underlying elements and masked their coders as a pickled python coder. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [WIP][BEAM-12501] Don't attempt graceful shutdown in SubprocessServer on Windows
body:

title: [BEAM-12495] Fail early when attempting to group multiple columns with dropna=False
body:
I discovered this bug when testing with pandas 1.3.0rc1. Due to https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/36470 `groupby(dropna=False)` doesn't work when grouping on a MultiIndex, which unfortunately is always the case for us when grouping on multiple columns. This PR detects that case and fails early. I think the only way to _fix_ BEAM-12495 is to send an upstream fix. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------
